commit_list.message:
change specification (installation, startup (workers.yml))

- Change installation specification
Install library files under RAILS_ROOT/lib.
Daemonize#daemonize method close all input/output stream. So thus,
after initializing environment.rb, Logger for ActiveRecord is also
closed by daemonize routine. This causes exception in ActiveRecord
method calls. To initialize environment.rb after daemonize call,
first steps of DRb::Runner and Rinda::WorkerRunner could not use
Rails functions (minimal functions provided by active_support are
used by Rinda::WorkerRunner).

- Change startup process
Only one worker class is specified by --worker option. It is not
enough for automatic startup and not flexible to specify startup
options for Workers, e.g. specify different acceptable method name
list or arguments list for each thread. To establish it, create
new configuration file config/workers.yml. config/workers.yml has
one array instance. Each entry describes rinda_worker process
configuration. rinda_worker process configuration has rinda_worker
thread configurations. Each thread configuration has Rinda::Worker
initialize argument options.

exit_request (exit_worker) implementation is also fixed to
fit the above specification.
commit_list.repo_description: Rails plugin to help using Rinda environment with Rails

commit_list.repo_description: Rails plugin to help using Rinda environment with Rails
Rails plugin to help using Rinda environment with Rails

commit_list.message:
daemonize process, install/uninstall, option handling

- daemonize process
ActiveRecord.buffered_logger is closed by daemonize method.
It causes exception during WorkerRecord handling in CronWorker.
Furthermore, SQLite3 may not support open files across fork()
system call.
http://www.sqlite.org/faq.html#q6

It is better to require environment.rb after daemonize.
script/server takes similar approach.

To respond this requirement, we need to remove dependency
to Rails class autoload function. We write 'require' using
relative path and directly install libraries into RAILS_ROOT/lib.

- option handling
option code is duplicated between drb/runner.rb, rinda_ts,
rinda/worker_runner.rb. By adding add_options() method,
refactored it.

commit_list.message:
bug fix and refactoring

- Remove class name attribute from job tuple.

The class name of the target instance is specified by the prefix
of request type (first attribute of the job tuple). Class name
will be required only for using :name tuple (Ring tuple).

- Check already running DRb.server in init_ts

Prevent to run multiple DRb.server in the same process or thread.
DRb.server could be used by multiple threads because it create
new thread to handle request from remote Objects.

commit_list.message:
first version.

FILES:
lib/
  drb/runner.rb: dRuby server start up class template
  rinda/worker.rb: Worker class template
    Worker status: @request/@executing/@done
    Renew function is added to detect worker process down
  rinda/worker_runner.rb: dRuby server for Worker start up class
  template
    Threads refer worker instance (Thread.current[:worker]) to
    treat GC
  rinda/client.rb: DelegateClass of Worker used as a client
  library for job submitter

generators/
  provide app/workers/xxx_worker.rb generator.

test/

config/
  rinda_min_environment.rb: environment file loading minimum
  rails libraries (for rinda_ts, rinda_logger)
  rinda_environment.rb: environment file loading default rails
  libraries (for rinda_worker)

script/
  rinda_ts: tuple space server start up script
  rinda_logger: logger server (for processes running on the same
  nodes) start up script
  rinda_worker: worker server start up script
  rinda_worker_cluster: multiple worker server start up script
  (for Ruby 1.8.7, because of the green thread. JRuby does not
   need this.)

install.rb, uninstall.rb
  use FileUtils to copy config and script files
  show README

TODO:
- need test for lib/drb, lib/rinda and scripts
- add rake tasks to handling SSH enabled nodes.
- add rake tasks to generate PKI keys for SSL/TLS

commit_list.message:
generalize Laas's update

* generalize Laas's update
Laas's update may not work the cases below:

@<md:EntityDescriptor
xmlns:md='urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:metadata'...@

So thus, use has_name?() method to compare String and
a XML Entity name. It can compare them with/without
name prefix (e.g. "md:").

* fix certificate handling for SP
commit_list.repo_description: SAML (Shibboleth SP) middleware for Rack
SAML (Shibboleth SP) middleware for Rack

commit_list.message:
add Session management & Shibboleth DS support

* Session management
  How: Using Rack::Session (ActionDispatch::Session) to manage session
  Why: To check that the client is the same in request phase and
response phase for DS and AuthnRequest/Response (security requirements)
       To keep SAML session for the specified period (performance
requirements)

* Shibboleth Discovery Service (DS)
  To support IdP selection

commit_list.message:
fix sync_worker.rb bug

File descriptor should be closed after CSV::Writer.generate
block.

Before:
CSV::Writer.generate(File.open(filename, "wb"), "\t") do |csv|
...

After:
file = File.open(filename, "wb")
CSV::Writer.generate(file, "\t") do |csv|
...
end
file.close

commit_list.message:
change switch_worker spec

rinda_ts (TupleSpace) can not receive Location class instance
because it is difficult or expensive to initialize unused model
class in rinda_ts by loading rails environment during start up.
To handle rails model in rinda_ts, convert them to Hash by
using attributes method.

Example:
client = Rinda::Client.new('switch')
location = Location.first
client.write_request('update', location.attributes)

Rewrite sync_worker.rb and ssh.rb to fit the spec.
